Generation V.Black: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
Generation V.White: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
Generation V.Black 2: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
Generation V.White 2: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

Generation VI.X: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
Generation VI.Y: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

Generation VIII.Sword: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It's soaking up static electricity because it can't produce a charge on its own.
Generation VIII.Shield: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They're often found sticking to Yamper's hindquarters.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
Generation IX.Violet: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
